Definition at line 55 of file UExpr.h.

float UExpr::GetValue (  )  const [virtual]

shouldn't have been able to be parsed! This shouldn't be possible.

if there is only one term, return early.

Note that we reduce in order of precedence. precedence: * / %, + -, < > <= >= == !=, && ||

go through all of the terms.

initialize the first entry in the stack.

advance past the first term in the array.

go through the remaining terms in the array.

do the division and take the fractional part.

push onto the stack.

shouldn't be possible to overwrite.

are we done? This means we hit all multiplication, division, or modulus. If this is the case, then there is no need to reduce further. We can simply return early.

now reduce addition/subtraction. initialize the first element in valueStack1.

push the new entry onto valueStack1. At this point, should be either a comparison or a logical operation.

are we done? This means we hit all addition or subtraction. If this is the case, then there is no need to reduce further.

now reduce comparisons! initialize the first element in valueStack0.

push the new entry onto valueStack0. At this point, should be a logical operation.

are we done? This means we hit all comparisons. If this is the case, then there is no need to reduce further.

now reduce logical operations! initialize the first element in valueStack1.

shouldn't be possible! At this point, all operations except logical operations should have been reduced! If we get here, then an operation was added, and is not supported correctly, or there is an error in the existing logic somewhere.

all done!

Implements UExprTerm.
